[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Missing Validation] Can the TransactionFees mapping store MethodFees with zero or null values, breaking fee collection logic? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Inconsistent State] Can partial updates to TransactionFees leave some methods with old fees and others with new fees, creating arbitrage opportunities? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Symbol Injection] Can TransactionFees store fees with invalid token symbols, causing runtime errors when fees are collected? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Unbounded Growth] Can the TransactionFees mapping grow without bounds as new methods are added, eventually hitting storage limits? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Fee Frontrunning] Can attackers observe pending TransactionFees updates and front-run them to exploit temporary fee mismatches? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Multi-Token Confusion] Can TransactionFees with multiple fee tokens create confusion about which token is actually charged? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Case Sensitivity] Can the TransactionFees mapping use case-sensitive method name keys, allowing bypasses via case variations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Deletion Issues] Can deleted entries in TransactionFees be read as null/default, causing free method execution? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: TransactionFees] [Whitespace Attack] Can method names with leading/trailing whitespace bypass fee checks in TransactionFees mapping? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Configuration Injection] Can arbitrary keys be inserted into the Configurations mapping without validation, polluting the configuration space? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Value Corruption] Can the Configurations mapping store malformed BytesValue data that crashes deserializers in consuming contracts? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Key Squatting] Can an attacker pre-populate critical configuration keys before legitimate initialization, hijacking system parameters? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [DoS via Large Values] Can the Configurations mapping accept arbitrarily large BytesValue entries, causing out-of-memory errors when read? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Missing Key Validation] Can empty string keys or special characters in Configurations keys bypass access control checks? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Type Confusion] Can the Configurations BytesValue storage allow type confusion where contracts expect different data formats? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Immutability Violation] Can critical Configurations be overwritten multiple times, violating assumptions about configuration stability? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Deletion Attack] Can an attacker delete critical configuration entries by setting them to empty BytesValue, breaking dependent systems? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Encoding Issues] Can the Configurations BytesValue accept improperly encoded protobuf data, causing deserialization failures? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Version Mismatch] Can the Configurations mapping store values with incompatible schema versions, breaking backward compatibility? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Namespace Collision] Can different contracts accidentally use the same configuration keys, causing cross-contract interference? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Read Before Write] Can reading uninitialized Configurations return default values instead of failing, masking configuration errors? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Configuration/ConfigurationState.cs] [State: Configurations] [Atomic Update Failure] Can partial Configurations updates leave the system in an inconsistent state if some but not all keys are updated? (High)
